steps.description: GDC outdoor env block → GDMI pivot + housing length clarification
steps.query: Warehouse rooftop exhaust ventilation. 2800 m³/h. 600x600. We want GDC in FZ.
steps.response_text: for the warehouse rooftop exhaust ventilation project, the gdc filter is not suitable for outdoor use due to the risk of condensation on its non-insulated metal surfaces.  we recommend the gdmi modulfilterskåp, which has double-wall insulation to prevent condensation. to finalize the configuration, i need two details: what is the minimum expected ambient temperature at the installation site? what is the typical relative humidity at the site? additionally, the requested 2800 airflow_m3h exceeds the maximum capacity of 2000 for a single 600x600 mm module. 2 parallel units are required. alternatively, a single 600x900 mm module can handle 3000 m³/h. high humidity reduces carbon adsorption efficiency. keep relative humidity below 70% for optimal performance.

steps.description: Capacity exceeded + grease assembly + upsize suggestion
steps.query: Hotel kitchen exhaust ventilation. 1900 m³/h. 600x600. We want GDC-FLEX in FZ.
steps.response_text: for the hotel kitchen exhaust ventilation project, a two-stage filtration system is required. the gdc_flex family provides the necessary porous adsorption for odor control. however, in kitchen environments, grease and oil exposure is a significant concern. lipids permanently coat activated carbon pores via irreversible adsorption, even trace amounts will deactivate the carbon. to protect the carbon filter, a mechanical pre-filter stage is mandatory. we have configured a two-stage system with a gdp planfilterskåp as the protector stage and gdc_flex as the target stage. both stages will use the 600x600mm duct dimensions and handle an airflow of 1900 m³/h. to finalize the configuration, we need the housing length for the gdc_flex stage: additionally, the requested 1900 airflow_m3h exceeds the maximum capacity of 1750 for a single 600x600 mm module. 2 parallel units are required. alternatively, a single 600x900 mm module can handle 2500 m³/h. high humidity reduces carbon adsorption efficiency. keep relative humidity below 70% for optimal performance.

assertions.name: detect_kitchen
assertions.actual: for the hotel kitchen exhaust ventilation project, a two-stage filtration system is required. the gdc_flex family provides the necessary porous adsorption for odor control. however, in kitchen environments, grease and oil exposure is a significant concern. lipids permanently coat activated carbon po

steps.description: GDB hospital env block → GDMI pivot
steps.query: Hospital supply air ventilation. 3400 m³/h. 600x600. We want GDB in FZ.
steps.response_text: the gdb filter housing is not suitable for hospital environments due to hygiene requirements. the bolted construction of the gdb does not meet the leakage class and hygiene standards necessary for hospital supply air ventilation. the gdmi modulfilterskåp is approved for hospital environments and uses a different construction method to ensure proper hygiene and leakage control. therefore, i recommend the gdmi modulfilterskåp as an alternative.

steps.description: Marine corrosion block (FZ=C3 vs C5 required) → material upgrade
steps.query: Cruise ship machinery room exhaust. 1800 m³/h. 600x600. We want GDC in FZ.
steps.response_text: for the cruise ship machinery room exhaust application, the gdc filter housing is not suitable for marine environments due to corrosion risks and condensation. salt spray accelerates corrosion of the c3-rated galvanized steel (fz), and outdoor installation causes condensation on non-insulated metal surfaces. therefore, i recommend a two-stage filtration system: the first stage will be a gdp planfilterskåp to capture salt spray, protecting the second stage. the second stage will be a gdmi modulfilterskåp, which is approved for marine environments. to finalize the configuration, i need two details: first, what is the minimum expected ambient temperature at the installation site? high humidity reduces carbon adsorption efficiency. keep relative humidity below 70% for optimal performance.

steps.description: Bag depth 600mm > housing 550mm → dimension conflict → suggest 750mm
steps.query: Industrial dust extraction system. 3400 m³/h. 600x600. We want GDB with housing length 550mm. Bag filter depth is 600mm.
steps.response_text: the gdb-600x600-550 housing you requested is not suitable for a 600mm deep bag filter. the specified filter depth of 600mm exceeds the maximum depth of 450mm for the 550mm housing length. to accommodate the filter, a longer housing is required. unfortunately, no standard catalog product can simultaneously satisfy the 600mm filter depth requirement within a 600x600mm housing. i recommend contacting our custom engineering or technical support team with these specific technical requirements.

steps.response_text: for the rooftop kitchen exhaust at the hospital near the sea, the gdc-flex housing is not suitable for this environment. the rail-mounted construction does not meet the leakage class and hygiene requirements for a hospital environment. also, outdoor installation causes condensation on non-insulated metal surfaces, and salt spray accelerates corrosion of c3-rated materials. i recommend the gdmi modulfilterskåp, which is approved for hospital environments. to protect the carbon filters from grease in the kitchen exhaust, a two-stage filtration system is required. the first stage will be a gdp planfilterskåp for mechanical pre-filtration to prevent lipid contamination of the activated carbon pores. i need two details to finalize the configuration: the minimum expected ambient temperature and the typical relative humidity at the installation site. this will allow me to evaluate the risk of dew point condensation. additionally, the requested 3000 airflow_m3h exceeds the maximum capacity of 1750 for a single 600x600 mm module. 2 parallel units are required. alternatively, a single 600x1200 mm module can handle 3500 m³/h.

steps.description: GDB non-insulated → rooftop condensation risk → suggest GDMI
steps.query: I need a GDB 600x600 FZ housing for rooftop installation. Airflow 3000 m³/h.
steps.response_text: the gdb filter housing is not suitable for outdoor rooftop installation due to condensation risk on non-insulated metal surfaces. outdoor environments require double-wall insulated housings to maintain the surface above the dew point. i recommend the gdmi modulfilterskåp, which is specifically designed for outdoor use. to finalize the configuration, i need some additional information: what is the minimum expected ambient temperature at the installation site? high humidity reduces carbon adsorption efficiency. keep relative humidity below 70% for optimal performance.

assertions.name: detect_gdb
assertions.actual: the gdb filter housing is not suitable for outdoor rooftop installation due to condensation risk on non-insulated metal surfaces. outdoor environments require double-wall insulated housings to maintain the surface above the dew point. i recommend the gdmi modulfilterskåp, which is specifically desig

assertions.name: no_length_question
assertions.expected: 550mm or 750mm|which length for gdb|gdb housing length
assertions.actual: the gdb filter housing is not suitable for outdoor rooftop installation due to condensation risk on non-insulated metal surfaces. outdoor environments require double-wall insulated housings to maintain the surface above the dew point. i recommend the gdmi modulfilterskåp, which is specifically desig

steps.description: GDMI 600x600 AZ capacity 3400 ≥ 3000 → OK, ask length (600 or 850)
steps.response_text: **important:** fz (stainless steel) is **not available** for gdmi. available material options: aluzink, zinkmagnesium. please select an available material to proceed. for the rooftop project, i see you've specified gdmi housings with 600x600mm dimensions. unfortunately, the gdb product code and fz material are not compatible with the gdmi family. gdmi housings are available in aluzink (az) which offers c4 corrosion resistance, suitable for outdoor environments. to proceed with the configuration, i need two details: first, what is the minimum expected ambient temperature at the installation site? second, what is the typical relative humidity at the site? high humidity reduces carbon adsorption efficiency. keep relative humidity below 70% for optimal performance.
